results.title: Well laid plans (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Central to all management action is planning and decision making. Both involve information collecting and making choices. In some situations it is best to involve others in the process. Planning and decision making in situations of high certainty are considered in the context of present day management culture.

results.title: The More things change (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
This episode looks at the pervasiveness of change, how to plan for change, why change is resisted and the relationship between learning and change. Change is a process that must begin with individuals.

results.title: Everybody's business: management in action (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Today the workplace is changing. Quantum changes in the world economy, in technology and in society itself have brought about a revolution in the nature of work. Increasing use of self-management strategies have led to a far greater sharing of management functions through the whole workforce. The classic functions of management - planning, organising, leading, and controlling are becoming everybody’s business, hence the title of this series. Throughout the series, reporter Cheryl Hall explores the new approaches to management in all sectors of the workforce. Kerry O’Brien speaks to experts on the key issues of management today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Management: the bottom line (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Management must strive to achieve many outcomes. They are responsible to the organisation, the staff, the customer and society. Productivity improvement is their primary responsibility. However, this must be considered relative to the needs and wants of all the stakeholders. Meeting the needs and desires of all these people is often a very complex balancing act. How well it is carried out is a measure of the managers. This episode is likely to be a full scale debate among Australian managers, unionists, commentators, and employees about the role of management in the 1990’s.

results.title: Equal chances: equal opportunities
results.creator_credit: Jean Leduc and Les Films d'Olivier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “European Community”.
Deals with the notion of equal work for equal pay. Shows examples of women employed in non-traditional jobs. Encourages girls to look at all areas of employment and suggests that equality of job opportunity should begin at school.
results.description:

results.title: Youth of the Nation
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Tara from Redan told this story because “…its my greatest expertise. I’m young, I’m surrounded by young people everyday and advocate on behalf of them so it makes sense”.

results.title: Music: the language of us all
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Dominique’s story is about the use of music as the most honest and universal form of free expression.

results.title: The Importance of Equality
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. This story made by Nosrat from Coburg shows how the principles fought for in the Eureka rebellion have resonance around the world today.
